quote: He concluded in the last scene that we are given two choices in life. We can allow ourselves to love and care for others, which makes us vulnerable to their sickness, death, or rejection. Or we can protect ourselves by refusing to love. Lewis decided that it is better to feel and to suffer than to go through life isolated, insulated, and lonely.
author: James C. Dobson, Life on the Edge: A Young Adult's Guide to a Meaningful Future
category: better, c-s-lewis, care, choices, death, feel, insulated, isolated, life, lonely, love, others, ourselves, protect, refusing, rejection, shadowlands, sickness, suffer, their, vulnerable

quote: Don’t just think about what you missed! Don’t continue to dwell on your past mistakes. You shall also miss something in life, consciously or unconsciously! You shall never be able to do all things excellently in life though you must try to! The lesson from what you missed and its application for a better tomorrow is what matter! Move your thought! Move your body!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: accidents, choices, free-your-mind, haste, impatience, misfortunes, mistakes, moving-on, perfection, perfectionist, regrets, shift-your-thinking, thinking-positive, wrong

quote: You're the one who has to live with your choice," she says. "Everyone else will get over it, move on, no matter what you decide. But you never will.
author: Veronica Roth, The Transfer

quote: Following imprinting, valuations become locally coherent, as the consumer attempts to reconcile future decisions of a "similar kind" with the initial one. This creates an illusion of order, because consumers' coherent responses to subsequent changes in conditions disguise the arbitrary nature of the initial, foundation choice.
author: Dan Ariely

quote: I’m not brave
author: it’s just that all other choices have been thrown out the window.

quote: The paradox of choice; the more options there are, the harder it is to chose and the higher the expectations and so, the satisfaction is diminished.
author: R.A.Delmonico

quote: People do get hypnotized by the hard choices and stop looking at the alternatives. The will to be stupid is a powerful force
author: Lois McMaster Bujold, Brothers in Arms

quote: Life is a series of decisions and reactions. It is the things you do and the things that are done to you.And then it's over.
author: Noah Hawley, Before the Fall

quote: Strategy is about making choices
author: it’s about deliberately choosing to be different.

quote: Choices are made before explanations, whether or not we care to know it.
author: L.S. Hilton, Maestra

quote: You have two choices in life: Live the life you want or live the life of acceptance.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: If we are with someone out of choice, we should act accordingly, and choose to communicate rather than deteriorate.
author: lauren klarfeld
category: choices, communication, communication-quotes, communication-skills, deterioration, love, love-quotes, mindfulness, mindfulness-practice, relationships

quote: You should have gone yourself, you ask for a Coke and they come back with orange drink. No one understands the martyrdom of the volunteers for the trip to food concession.
author: Colson Whitehead, John Henry Days

quote: We are not always shaped by our parents, Cas. We're shaped by our choices.
author: Sarah Dalton, White Hart
category: choices, heroine, inspirational, make-it-happen, sarah-dalton, white-hart

quote: Shame control us and our lives, it makes the choices we just state in spec and watch what's doing... as far as now it goes like a bot... auto!
author: Deyth Banger
category: auto, bot, choices, control, lives, makes, our, shame

quote: You don't belong to someone who considers you as an option!
author: Aanu

quote: Sometimes you have to try all options to find out the best one for you.!
author: Best-Quote
category: choices, life, love, motivational, options, try-again

quote: Some choices, once you make them, they stay made.
author: Sherri L. Smith, Orleans

quote: People always make choices, always take sides!
author: Deyth Banger
category: always, choices, humankind, mankind, people, sides

quote: Because choices need time, the fulness of time, time being the horizontal axis of morality - you make a decision and then you wait and see, wait and see.
author: White Teeth - Zadie Smith

quote: I keep saying there's no Choice, and what I've meant is that you can't choose: you have no right or ability to select one of the two alternatives. But I didn't go far enough. There's no Choice because the Choice itself is wrong. It's a false dilemma. The alternatives are not alternatives at all. Long versus short, quiet versus heroic: they're the same. In the scope of infinity, in a universe with no edge, human history is a flare and human consciousness is a blink. All lives are short and all lives are quiet.But all lives are glorious too, Cal. To live! To live like a human! You are ordinary and extraordinary all at once. You have a heart that contracts and relaxes and beats out your moments. You are alive and you know you are alive. Your too-short time is long e
author: Kate Hattemer, The Land of 10,000 Madonnas

quote: We are our choices.. That's why I am so afraid to choose.. Because more than anything else, I am afraid of facing myself..
author: Laarni Venus Marie Nillama

quote: «And in the end» said the witch to the drowning prince «You've been the one choosing the thornless path in spite of knowing where it could lead. The one who afraid of the pricking roses, plunged himself into an abyss without petals
author: Nur Bedeir
category: abyss, choice, choices, choices-and-consequences, drowning, ending, endings, fairy-tales, fear, petals, regret, roses, thorns, witches

quote: When people are vulnerable to control, they feel that they are selfish for deciding what to do with their own property. In reality, deciding for ourselves is the only way we can ever have true love, for then we are giving freely.
author: Henry Cloud, Changes That Heal: How to Understand the Past to Ensure a Healthier Future
category: choices, control, controlling-others, controlling-people, decisions, manipulative-people, selfish, vulnerability, vulnerable

quote: Although it pains me to admit it, I am quite familiar with the holes in life. And this familiarity is due to the fact that I spend far more time in these holes than I spend on the paths that brought me to them.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough, Flecks of Gold on a Path of Stone: Simple Truths for Profound Living
category: blind, blindness, careless, carelessness, choices, decisions, discernment, error, errors, familiar, familiarity, hole, holes, mistake, mistakes, road, road-of-life, stupidity, time, wisdom

quote: When you heart knows it doesn't belong there, it will continue to self sabotage your future, until you make the choice you wanted, but found a million excuses not to pursue.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: being-selective, choices, decisions, givibg-up, love, pursue

quote: None of this is your fault,' I told him. 'None of it. You aren't responsible for what other people do, good or bad. Everyone is just making the choices they think will help them get by.
author: Alexandra Bracken, Never Fade

quote: My mom used to say, ‘Life isn’t fair,’“ said Shadow.“Of course she did,” said Wednesday. “It’s one of those things that moms say, right up there with ‘If all your friends jumped off a cliff would you do it too?’”“You stiffed that girl for ten bucks, I slipped her ten bucks,” said Shadow, doggedly. “It was the right thing to do.”Someone announced that their plane was boarding. Wednesday stood up. “May your choices always be so clear,” he said.
author: Neil Gaiman, American Gods

quote: When Ego is in control it judges and punishes. But love forgives and heals. Surrendering, is one of the most powerful choices one can make.The doors of love only open for the person who is prepared to let his ego go. To surrender one's ego for someone else is love; to surrender one's ego for all is divine love.﻿
author: Angie karan
category: choices, divine-love, doors-of-love, ego, surrendering, when-ego-is-in-control

quote: Your human gods love to present you with such riddles and challenges, or so it has seemed to me for most of my life... You often seem to prefer difficult choices when simple alternatives are available; it is a constant source of amazement to my kind.
author: Raymond E. Feist, Honored Enemy

quote: Choice is an illusion, what we eat is again illusion, nothing matters when it's illusion... so how did you survive???
author: Deyth Banger

quote: Tomorrow is tomorrow and today is today. Tomorrow will come and we shall still say today. Worry not yourself about tomorrow but today! Plan your tomorrow today and tomorrow will never be a regretful yesterday for you. Those who least plan their tomorrow today always meet tomorrow and still live in yesterday.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: choices, choices-and-attitude, choices-and-consequences, life-choices, make-the-very-best-of-your-life, plan-your-life, regrets, stay-focused, today-is-your-day

quote: Aside God, you have just one boss! That is you. You choose to be a good boss or a bad boss with the business of your life! That is you!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

quote: After all, if you run far enough, no one can catch you.
author: V.E. Schwab, A Gathering of Shadows

quote: But at the last minute, I turned left, because I never had before, and because I had time to go down a different road.
author: Robyn Schneider, Extraordinary Means

quote: You get older, and you make your choices, and one by one the doors shut.
author: Rebecca Podos, The Mystery of Hollow Places

quote: When you want to do something that isn’t the ‘norm’ you will be made to feel like you have a problem and if you hear it often enough then you start to believe it too.
author: Radhika Vaz, Unladylike: A Memoir

quote: Don't worry, my little lump of rock. Everybody gets a chance to choose. Or else where would irony come from?
author: Catherynne M. Valente, The Boy Who Lost Fairyland

quote: Luck is made by the making the right choices at the right timing and place.
author: Steven Redhead, Life Is Simply A Game

quote: Why? As much fun as a hospital sounds, I'd rather spend the evening dancing with an amazing, smart, funny, interesting, beautiful girl who has the most incredible green eyes I've ever seen. Sophie, will you go to the dance with me?
author: Leslea Wahl, The Perfect Blindside

quote: Mr.Nobody everyone should watch this film - Everything is about choices - Remember that before you watch the film.
author: Deyth Banger
category: choice, choices, film, mr, nobody, remember

quote: Oh that I had the opportunity to rethink so many of my decisions, for the pitfalls into which I have so frequently fallen were often dug with the shovel of those very decisions.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough, Flecks of Gold on a Path of Stone: Simple Truths for Profound Living
category: choices, decide, decisions, direction, dug, errors, mistakes, opportunity, pitfalls, reconsider, rethink, shovel, wisdom

quote: Control or be controlled are the choices that will make life different.
author: Steven Redhead, Life Is Simply A Game

quote: It ain't kin we? It's will we?
author: John Steinbeck, The Grapes of Wrath

quote: Well, that's the thing about choices, isn't it? There are always more to make. I've never seen a street where you couldn't cross to the other side.
author: Beatriz Williams, The Forgotten Room

quote: Create you own singleness, your own loneliness, and know that you know this is exactly what you are doing. And feel damn right about it.
author: Margaret Aranda

quote: (...) 6,400,099,980 moments that constitute a single day. His point is that every single one of those moments provides an opportunity to reestablish our will. Even the snap of a finger, he says, provides us with sixty-five opportunities to wake up and to choose actions that will produce beneficial karma and turn our lives around.
author: Ruth Ozeki, A Tale for the Time Being
category: changes, choices, desicions, inspirational, life, opportunities, time, will

quote: You have the chance to create
author: all the choices are yours to make if you decide to do so.
category: Steven Redhead, Unleash The Power of Your Heart and Mind

quote: I need to do something about college, but I’m not sure what.”“Where have you decided to apply?”“Nowhere yet. Any time I think about the schools I’ve visited, I feel overwhelmed. The campuses are so big that I know I’ll get lost. I dread making new friends. And the professors acted too busy to deal with someone like me. My parents will be wasting a huge amount of money.”“Your fears are no different than most high school seniors.” He studied me thoughtfully. “Must you go to college?”I opened my mouth to say Of course, I must—and then shut it again. The concept didn’t bother me nearly as much as it should have. Skipping college would be crazy. Right? It was hard enough for a disabled person to find a job, but being disabled with no degree would make it hopeless. “I don’t have a choice.”“Perhaps you have more choices than you realize.
author: Elizabeth Langston, Wishing for You

quote: But she does it anyway, and I sit beside her...because strength is a choice.
author: Nadine Brandes, A Time to Speak

quote: It may not be nice to be good, 6655321. It may be horrible to be good. And when I say that to you I realize how self-contradictory that sounds. I know I shall have many sleepless nights about this. What does God want? Does God want goodness or the choice of goodness? Is a man who chooses the bad perhaps in some way better than a man who has the good imposed upon him?
author: Anthony Burgess, A Clockwork Orange

quote: Fluttershyes are like regular shyes, only shinier, and, apparently - also shyer. Whenever petted - they don't flutter, but run away instead.
author: Will Advise, Nothing is here...
category: alternative, alternatively, butterflies, cats, choices, flutter, meow, nothing, run, run-away, running, running-away, shine, shining, shiny, shoes, shy, shyness

quote: You shouldn't have to convince anyone to choose you. There is no real choice in love.
author: Tarryn Fisher, F*ck Love

quote: Redemption. What a laughable concept. When he looked over his life, he couldn't see where he had first stepped off the righteous path. More important, had he even ever laid a single foot on that path?
author: Michael R. Fletcher, Beyond Redemption

quote: ..More choices in a limited time didn't mean didn't mean you could do everything-it meant that you could do anything, so you probably did nothing, frozen with indecision.
author: Brent Weeks, The Broken Eye
category: ability, anything, choice, choices, decide, decision, do, everything, freeze, frozen, indecision, option, options, truth

quote: I am not you and all my choices have already been made, good and bad.
author: Conn Iggulden, Conqueror

quote: At age 13, I was violently mugged at a busy train station. There were dozens of onlookers, but none of them lent a hand ... That was a defining point in that stage of my life. After that, I could never tell myself that it was someone else's problem, or let a situation pass me by if I felt something had to be done. I knew from experience that all too often, no one else would act.
author: Adrián Lamo

quote: Letting someone control your life for you and decide what you will be is a sure way of creating things to regret on the day of reckoning.
author: Innocent Mwatsikesimbe, Mirror
category: choices, inspirational, life, life-lessons, motivational, self-growth

quote: Choices are abundant, it is the right decision which is the rare one!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
category: abundant, choice, choices, choices-quotes, mehmet-murat-ildan, rare, right, right-decision, right-decisions

quote: I know it feels like you have all these options and when you make a decision, you lose a world of possibilities. But the reality is, until you make a decision, you have nothing at all.
author: Janet Fitch

quote: Sometimes horrible choices can lead to the right decision, its not where we start that's important but where we end.
author: Ava Harrison, Imperfect Truth
category: ava-harrison, bad, choices, good, right, wrong

quote: I returned to my existence, the existence I had chosen instead of you.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri, Unaccustomed Earth

quote: Our twenties can be like living beyond time. When we graduate from school, we leave behind the only lives we have ever known, ones that have been neatly packaged in semester-sized chunks with goals nestled within. Suddenly, life opens up and the syllabi are gone. There are days and weeks and months and years, but no clear way to know when or why any one thing should happen. It can be a disorienting, cave-like existence. As one twentysomething astutely put it, "The twentysomething years are a whole new way of thinking about time. There's this big chunk of time and a whole bunch of stuff that needs to happen somehow.
author: Meg Jay, The Defining Decade: Why Your Twenties Matter--And How to Make the Most of Them Now

quote: The lottery question might get you thinking about what you would do if talent and money didn't matter. But they do. The question twentysomethings need to ask themselves is what they would do with their lives if they didn't win the lottery.
author: Meg Jay, The Defining Decade: Why Your Twenties Matter--And How to Make the Most of Them Now

quote: We all have our own road to walk. Whether rocky, curving, straight or smooth, what good is a lonely road? It’s when we run and intersect with other roads that defines our road. When road meets road do we get direction, and choices to cross into another life.
author: Anthony Liccione
category: chance, choices, cross-over, crossroads, difine, direction, friendships, hardships, intersections, life, lonely, people, relationships, road, single-life, soulmates, successes, way

quote: If the first step in establishing a professional identity is claiming our interests and talents, then the next step is claiming a story about our interests and talents, a narrative we can take with us to interviews and coffee dates (...) a story that balances complexity and cohesion is frankly, diagnostic.
author: Meg Jay, The Defining Decade: Why Your Twenties Matter--And How to Make the Most of Them Now

quote: You become what you believe, decide, and act upon.
author: Anese Cavanaugh

quote: I admired her choices though I wouldn't have made them.
author: Karen Joy Fowler, We Are All Completely Beside Ourselves

quote: Never make permanent eternal decisions based on sense knowledge.
author: Kingsley Opuwari Manuel
category: choices, decision-making, decision-quotes, decisions, inspirational, spiritual, wisdom, young-minds

quote: I think part of making any decision in your twenties is realizing there is no twenty-four flavor table. It's a myth.
author: Meg Jay, The Defining Decade: Why Your Twenties Matter--And How to Make the Most of Them Now

quote: A happy marriage is a personal choice. The same way you decide to GET married? It's the same way you decide to STAY happily married!
author: Ngina Otiende, Blues to Bliss: Creating Your Happily-Ever-After In The Early Years

quote: With every rise in choices, the expectations double up which puts people deeper down into the rubble.
author: Ashish Patel
category: choices, expectations, facts-of-life, greed, guilt, guilty-conscience

quote: Life is supposedly filled with paths that enable unlimited choices, but that is a blatant lie. No one has free will until they are an adult, and by then the choices made for them have already set them on a passage that limits the choices they have yet to make.
author: J.D. Stroube, Caged in Darkness

quote: Choices, Choices, Choices!Listen to your instincts; you will make the best-choices.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: choices, crossroads, decision, guidance, inner-self, inner-voice, instinct, right-path, survival-instinct, wisdom-of-lailah-gifty-akita

quote: Surprising choice proves hardest to come by. Most choices, even the disastrous ones, are predictable.
author: Carrie Snyder, Girl Runner

quote: ... we live in a purposeful world with a linear movement to a grand climax. Thousands of sub-plots unfold enroute to the great finale. Behind your life is an unseen and up fathomed blueprint where every experience is purposeful. Within this divine plan we are not robots, but responsible moral agents. We make choices and we are responsible for these choices. But God, in a way that you and I will never fathom, integrates into his plan our choices long before they are ever made.
author: Jim Andrews

quote: It wasn't as if they had a choice. They were soldiers whose choices had ended when they had signed contracts and taken their oaths. Whether they had joined for reasons of patriotism, of romantic notions, to escape a broken home of some sort, or out of economic need, their job now was to follow the orders of other soldiers who were following orders, too. Somewhere, far from Iraq, was where the orders began, but by the time they reached Rustamiyah, the only choice left for a solider was to choose which lucky charm to tuck behind his body armor, or which foot to line up in front of the other, as he went out to follow the order of the day.
author: David Finkel, The Good Soldiers

quote: Sometimes doing what's right for your conscience is not always the most popular decision, but I can guarantee that in retrospect you won't regret the choice you made.
author: Tyler Oakley, Binge

quote: The fault lies with us, and only us. It's not fate, not genetics, not bad luck, and it's definitely not Mom and Dad. Ultimately it's us and our choices...but the most powerful spectacular thing is that the solution rests with us as well.
author: Louise Penny

quote: When the citizens of a nation have been made to love and adhere to values and virtues, then they make better choices.
author: Sunday Adelaja
category: adhere, choices, citizens, love, values, virtues

quote: Our choices are always in accordance to the prevailing value systems of our environment.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: There is a choice you have to make in everything you do. So keep in mind that in the end, the choice you make, makes you.
author: John Wooden

quote: If his choice now was to risk either sunshine with a chance of rain or heatstroke with a chance of tornado, he’d go with the sunshine.
author: Meredith Marple, The Year Mrs. Cooper Got Out More: A Great Wharf Novel

quote: Today is the sum of all the choices we made in our yesterdays. Choose wisely, for a secure, happy, and meaningful tomorrow.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: Choices, Choices, Choice.!
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: choices, daily-life, hope, hopeful, outlook, positive, self-motivation

quote: Decision, Decision, Decision!Choices, Choices, Choice.!Decision and choices define life.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: choices, decision, decision-making, define-yourself, educational-philosophy, life, mission, purposeful-living

quote: Don't let the doubt in, because when it does it ruins everything.
author: Karen Mosquera

quote: It is impossible for us to make any real advance until we take to heart this great truth, that without freedom of choice, without freedom of action, there are not such things as true moral qualities; there can only be submissive wearing of the cords that others have tied round our hands.
author: Auberon Herbert
category: anarchy, choices, coercion, free-will, freedom, happiness, individual, individualism, libertarian, liberty, non-aggression-principle, progress, statism, voluntaryism

quote: The good news is that every morning we have the choice; not to be controlled by circumstances nor our past but by purposely designing our day, hence our lives better. Not to react to life but to respond with love.
author: Bernard Kelvin Clive

quote: Sometimes our wants or needs have nothing to do with being ungrateful and everything to do with making a mistake.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: choices, circumstances, crossroads, decisions, gratituide, guilt-trips, lack-of-faith, mistakes, thankful, truth, truthfulness, ungrateful

quote: be patient enough to identify the real reasons why you meet people, situations and moments in time or else you would be patient enough to analyze the real reasons why you missed people, situations and moments in time in regret or in wonder
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: choices, decision, decision-quotes, life-test, living-well, missing-the-point, moments-in-time, moments-of-life, moments-quotes, opportunities, opportunities-in-life, opportunity-quotes, patience-and-timing, real-life-situations, regrets, regretting-quotes, situations-of-life, time-and-timing, wrong-choices, wrongs-and-rights

quote: There’s only one way to know if people are good or evil: look at the choices they make. We each contain precious and worthless, great and small. Never injure the great for the sake of the small, or the precious for the sake of the worthless. Small people nurture what is small in them; great people nurture what is great in them.
author: Mencius, Mencius

quote: Don’t you know that everything you do in life has consequences?
author: Kenneth Eade, Killer.com

quote: People only keep their eyes open out of habit. And, nothing more.
author: S.D. Lawendowski, Snapped
category: being-blind, blind, blindsided, choices, eyes, habit, habits, snapped

quote: There is no reason to contain your positive thoughts, words and emotions and many reasons to control your negative ones. Are you making the right choices?
author: Tom Cunningham

quote: Happiness is a conscious choice we make for ourselves. It has to come from within.
author: Beau Sides, Unseen Tears: The Challenges of Orphans and Orphanages in China
category: adoption, china, choices, happiness, happiness-in-life, orphans

quote: Yes, there's plenty of fish in the sea, but be gifted with a rare catch: that one which lives with "forever faithfulness." ~ Angelica Hopes, If I Could Tell You
author: Angelica Hopes

quote: We are defined by how we choose to exist. Responsibility towards and contribution to society is part of how we make a difference. Every human being wants to make a difference
author: one of the ways we might do this is through our contribution to communities .

quote: Be careful how you live. Someone is always watching and will look to you as an example, an excuse, or a warning. The message some choices send is why struggle to do the right thing when you can do the wrong thing and be happy. Should we be happy or should we be right?
author: Donna Lynn Hope
category: choice, choices, decision-making, decisions, dilemmas, example, warning

quote: At times, we need to let our choices die, for us to get a better direction in life.
author: Sunday Adelaja
category: better, choices, die, direction, get, let, need, us, we

quote: Our choices reflect the kind of person we are!
author: Anuranjita Kumar, Can I have it all?

quote: Whenever it comes to decision making, Remember the part about having confidence.
author: Auliq Ice

quote: Our being is more important than our doing. We are human beings, acting as though we are human doings. In our frenzied doing, we are often not conscious of our state of being. Yet our deepest impact comes from our state of being because it is at the root of our intentions, our choices, and our behavior.
author: Henna Inam, Wired for Authenticity: Seven Practices to Inspire, Adapt, & Lead
category: authentic-self, authenticity, behavior, choices, intentions, leadership, state-of-being

quote: Authenticity is a practice we choose in each present moment. It is not a plan or a destination to get to. The choices we make in the now are most important because in a fast-changing world, flexing to what’s happening now, and creating from it is a critical leadership skill.
author: Henna Inam, Wired for Authenticity: Seven Practices to Inspire, Adapt, & Lead

quote: I know there may be universes out there where I made different choices and they led me somewhere else, led me to someone else. And my heart breaks for every single version of me that didn't end up with you.
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid, Maybe in Another Life

quote: ...Except when I was alone. I'd hate myself. It's how we feel about ourselves when we're alone that must guide our decisions.
author: Tom Rob Smith, The Farm

quote: ...most of what bein human's about is making choices and payin the bills when they come due. Some of the choices are pretty goddam nasty, but that don't give a person leave to just walk away from em... In a case like that, you just have to make the best choice you can n then pay the price.
author: Stephen King, Dolores Claiborne

quote: Live and act within the limit of your knowledge and keep expanding it to the limit of your life. Redeem your mind from the hockshops of authority. Accept the fact that you are not omniscient, but playing a zombie will not give you omniscience—that your mind is fallible, but becoming mindless will not make you infallible—that an error made on your own is safer than ten truths accepted on faith, because the first leaves you the means to correct it, but the second destroys your capacity to distinguish truth from error.
author: Ayn Rand
category: authority, autonomy, choices, expansion, freedom, knowledge, self-trust, soveriegnty, truth

quote: People who own their lives do not feel guilty when they make choices about where they are going. They take other people into consideration, but when they make choices for the wishes of others, they are choosing out of love, not guilt; to advance a good, not to avoid a bad.
author: Henry Cloud, Boundaries: When to Say Yes, How to Say No to Take Control of Your Life

quote: It turns out the simplest choices have been far more important in the long run than I ever imagined.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: choices, choosing, consequences, freedoms, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, right-and-wrong

quote: Only dedication to God’s calling can make you say a firm “no” to everything that is in the way of its fulfillment.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: It's mind-boggling when you think about how important it is to do what you feel is right. You don't know what you'll be missing when you make a bad choice.
author: Jay Alton, Thunder Hawk
category: adulthood, choices, consequences, decisions, inspirational, life

quote: You may disagree. Personal history and national history do not always overlap, a point often overlooked in some of the broad strokes applied to the SG50 celebrations. But do consider your choices. In the age of Buzzfeed, we love lists. Make your own. No two lists will be the same, but collectively, they all say the same thing. They are all in search of a soul.
author: Neil Humphreys

quote: Life is choices...and sometimes other people's choices even more than your own.
author: Jamie  Mason, Monday's Lie

quote: We often prefer love for humans to love for God.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: While the big events of our lives create the impetus for change, it is the moment-by- moment choices that mold and shape us.
author: Karen Kimsey-House, Co-Active Leadership: Five Ways to Lead

quote: Don't judge someone's choices without first knowing their reason.
author: Robert Tew

quote: Don't let the poor choices you made negate the years you spent loving him.
author: Christine Brae, His Wounded Light

quote: I think life becomes a fabric of choices, interwoven, all related... I split my life into these two things, thief and lady
author: A.C. Gaughen, Lion Heart

quote: Satan's masterpiece of counterfeiting is the doctrine that there are only two choices, and he will show us what they are. It is true that there are only two ways, but by pointing us the way he wants us to take and then showing us a fork in that road, he convinces us that we are making the vital choice, when actually we are choosing between branches in his road. Which one we take makes little difference to him, for both lead to destruction. This is the polarization we find in the world today. Thus we have the choice between Shiz and Coriantumr-- which all the Jaredites were obliged to make. We have the choice between the wicked Lamanites (and they were that) and the equally wicked (Mormon says "more wicked") Nephites. Or between the fleshpots of Egypt and the stews of Babylon, or between the land pirates and the sea pirates of World War I, or between white supremacy and black supremacy, or between Vietnam and Cambodia, or between Bushwhachers and Jayhawkers, or between China and Russia, or between Catholic and Protestant, or between fundamentalist and atheist, or between right and left-- all of which are true rivals who hate each other. A very clever move of Satan!-- a subtlety that escapes us most of the time. So I ask Latter-day Saints, "What is your position frankly (I'd lake to take a vote here) regarding the merits of cigarettes vs. cigars, wine vs. beer, or heroin vs. LSD?" It should be apparent that you take no sides. By its nature the issue does not concern you. It is simply meaningless as far as your life is concerned. "What, are you not willing to stand up and be counted?" No, I am not. The Saints took no sides in that most passionately partisan of wars, the Civil War, and they never regretted it.
author: Nibley, Hugh

quote: When Scripture says, "As a man thinks, so is he," it is raw truth. How we approach life and react to its vagaries determines the bulk of our character. When it comes to harsh words from others, whether my skin absorbs like cotton or deflects like Teflon is a decision I make. All of that happens in a three-pound organ five-and-a-half inches across called my brain. In a very real sense, my world begins and ends between my ears. I don't have to be brain-dead to be brain-defeated.

quote: It was a stark choice: shoes or food; beauty or sustenance; the sensible or the self-indulgent. "I'll take the shoes," she said firmly.
author: Alexander McCall Smith, Tea Time for the Traditionally Built

quote: Meaning bad isn't the issue. Meaning you do what you do. Not without consequences for other people, of course, sometimes very grave ones. But it's not very helpful to regard your choices as a series of right or wrong moves. They don't define you as much as you define them
author: Ann Packer, The Dive From Clausen's Pier

quote: The next time someone gets on your nerves, remember your two choices: 1) share the problem; or 2) let them keep the problem to themselves.
author: David P. Ingerson

quote: Do you want to work like a slave and live like a king or do you want to work like a king and live like a slave? Your choice
author: Nathanael Kanyinga

quote: If you have a boat to sail, land becomes a choice! If you do not have a boat to sail, land becomes a fate! Create different choices so that you can have different fates!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quote: Beryl, on death: “No, you should never choose death, but it chooses you. Sometimes you know it’s coming, like my mother, and sometimes it takes you by surprise, like my friend Ariel’s uncle who got killed in a hunting accident. Sooner or later, we all get chosen, we all get taken from this world into the next. Whether we end up in Heaven or Hell, and what we do with our lives in the meantime—those are the choices we get to make.” – The Enemy’s Table
author: Charlotte Woollard, The Enemy's Table

quote: In all your life, only a few moments matter. Mostly you never get a good look at them except in hindsight, long after they've zipped past you: the moment when you decided whether to talk to that girl, slow down on that blind bend, stop and find that condom. I was lucky, I guess you could call it. I got to see one of mine face-to-face, and recognize it for what it was.
author: Tana French, Faithful Place

quote: But grownups were always in a turmoil, every possible action muddied over by thoughts of the consequences, by self-doubt, by selfimage, by feelings of love and responsibility. Every possible choice seemed to have drawbacks, and sometimes he didn't understand why the drawbacks were drawbacks. It was very hard.
author: Stephen King, The Shining

quote: At heart, we're all violent raging wolves, but in our actions we can be pacifists.
author: Polly Horvath, Everything on a Waffle

quote: Even in the darkest and most cruel person, there is still a kernel of good. and within the most perfect champion, there is also darkness. The question is, will one give into the dark or the light?
author: Morgan Rhodes, Falling Kingdoms

quote: If I had to embrace a definition of success, it would be that success is making the best choices we can . . . and accepting them.
author: Sheryl Sandberg, Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead

quote: When I was three years old and in my mother's arms, she looked down at me and said, "Son, the way I'm taking care of you now, when you get old, always have a woman to take care of you like this." Dig this! All I'm goin' do is rest and dress, buy gasoline and lean. I'm goin' buy diamond rings and have the best of everything. I'm goin' pimp whores.
author: Donald Goines, Whoreson

quote: I am a believer in sensible choices, so different from many of my own. Also in sensible names for children.
author: Margaret Atwood, Cat's Eye

quote: As you explore new opportunities and new directions, consider this:• How do I want to make a difference in the world?• How do I want to be remembered?• What kind of legacy do I want to leave behind?
author: Julie Connor, Dreams to Action Trailblazer's Guide
category: choices, decisions, direction, legacy, make-a-difference, opportunity

quote: I was told that this road would take me to the ocean of death, and turned back halfway. Since then crooked, round-about, godforsaken paths stretch out before me.
author: Arkady Strugatsky, Definitely Maybe

quote: It says if you mess up or make the wrong choice, you just have to keep at it until you do it right.
author: David Levithan, Love Is the Higher Law

quote: Everyone has more choices than they are made to believe.
author: Yesim Sireli

quote: I distrust the perpetually busy, always have. The frenetic ones spinning in tight little circles like poisoned rats. The slower ones, grinding away their fourscore and ten in righteousness and pain. They are the soul-eaters.
author: Mark Slouka, Essays from the Nick of Time: Reflections and Refutations

quote: Practical management of your time includes taking responsibility of your choices.
author: Julie Connor, Dreams to Action Trailblazer's Guide
category: choices, priority, responsibility, self-help, time, time-management

quote: A man of wisdom faces it all and makes his choices that actually can change a lot of things.
author: Kateryna Kei, Raven Boy
category: bravery, choices, life-lessons, making-choices, self-grows, wisdom, wisdom-inspirational

quote: The choice lay out for me. Stay on land or plunge into the icy depths of the sea. I always chose the sea.
author: Katherine McIntyre, By the Sea
category: choices, cold, icy, live-dangerously, ocean, sea, stay-safe

quote: Life is a choice. Your choices each day determine what outcomes happen in your life. It is by choice, not by chance, that will determine your life. An Unstoppable Life begins by taking responsibility for your choices.
author: Thomas Narofsky, You are Unstoppable!: Unleash Your Inspired Life
category: choices, choices-and-consequences, decisions, decsions, leadership, outcomes

quote: Contentment is a state of happiness and satisfaction. The choices we make are our own decisions for how we want to live our life.
author: Ellen J. Barrier
category: choices, content, contentment, happiness, happy, joyful, peaceful, satisfaction

quote: When you’re in love with two people, always choose the second. The fact that you are constantly thinking of the second person makes it obvious that the first will never fulfill you, unless the second person did not fulfill you either. At this point, you have to choose the third person because God is getting a little tired of your inattention and indecisiveness, and is planning on sending a fourth person into your life just to slap you around with the bible for not entering the promised land.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: choices, dating, decisions, familiar, familiarity, funny, guardian-angel, humor, johnny-depp, relationships, sarcasim, stay-true, temptation, the-past, wrong-path

quote: God is always willing to give you the best life possible. If you change your mind at any time you are free to go back to enjoying hell.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: add-humor, choices, god, got-to-laugh, hell, sarcastic

quote: We have to choose life. Choose risk. Choose love. The only safe place for our hearts is to dive deeply into the magnificent, eternal, ridiculous, overwhelming love that God has for us.
author: Stasi Eldredge, Becoming Myself: Embracing God's Dream of You
category: choices, hearts, life, love, risk, safety

quote: Life is a series of choices and all we can do is make them.
author: Kamal Ravikant, Live Your Truth
category: choices, leadership, motivation, organization, self-help-inspiration, truth

quote: Be at peace with your choices.They all serve you.
author: Alan Cohen

quote: Be good.See good.Choose good.It's a no-brainer.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: agency, choices, good, goodness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, right, right-and-wrong

quote: As a child my family's menu consisted of two choices
author: take it or leave it.

quote: But if I had to pick another person for her, I'd have to say you, Jess, since I hold you in such high regard. Yes, you would be a good match, but I am the lucky one this time! - Bryan Gifford
author: Maggie Brendan, Twice Promised

quote: And so it is, that if you believe it you can honestly choose what you want to be. But choose carefully, with your intuition, and have the courage to trust your choice! It is vital that we allow our self the privilege of quite space, for it is there we discover the passion that drives us to our heart's desire, to our destiny.
author: Braam Malherbe, The Great Run: Conquering the Sleeping Dragon Within: Life's Lessons on the Run

quote: What did that say about me? Had I become one of the monsters I thought I was fighting?“Things didn’t have to be like this,” I commented. “He could’ve made different choices.
author: J.M. Northup, Fears of Darkness

quote: People will go through their entire lives justifying every damn decision…they’ll fight for all the wrong things, until finally the right thing stares at them square in the face. That’s when the choices start to matter. Because in the end, you’re a creature of habit. So you may want to choose right, but choose wrong in the end — because you’re so damn used to it. It’s tragic, then again, life’s tragic
author: Rachel Van Dyken, Toxic

quote: We rarely consider that we're also formed by the decisions we didn't make, by events that could have happened but didn't, or by our lack of choices, for that matter.
author: Rabih Alameddine, An Unnecessary Woman

quote: What else? She is so beautiful. You don't get tired of looking at her. You never worry if she is smarter than you: You know she is. She is funny without ever being mean. I love her. I am so lucky to love her, Van Houten. You don't get to choose if you get hurt in this world, old man, but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices. I hope she likes hers.I do, Augustus.I do.
author: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

quote: Your choices and decisions are a reflection of how well you’ve set and followed your priorities.
author: Elizabeth George, A Woman's Daily Walk with God
category: choice, choices, christian, decisions, followed, priorities, reflect, reflection, set, well

quote: My fear is that of all the choices people face today, the one they rarely consider is, "How can I serve most effectively and fruitfully in the local church?" I wonder if the abundance of opportunities to explore today is doing less to help make well-rounded disciples of Christ and more to help Christians avoid long term responsibility and have less long-term impact.
author: Kevin DeYoung, Just Do Something: A Liberating Approach to Finding God's Will

quote: Your life is not a simulation
author: it's the real game. Play wisely.

quote: When your life feels like you're on a sailboat, with no wind to fill your sails, there are still choices. You can drop anchor and enjoy your surroundings. Start your motor, if you have one. Grab an oar and start paddling, or wait for the wind to fill your sails once again. There are always other choices while crossing the ocean of life…
author: James A. Murphy, The Waves of Life Quotes and Daily Meditations
category: always, anchor, choices, crossing, enjoy, feel, life, motor, oar, ocean, paddling, sailboat, sails, start, surroundings, wait, wind

quote: You know you are on the right spiritual track when you realize that doing the right thing is not something you should do; rather, it is something you want to do. It is even something you have to do for your own peace, and the well-being of others.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: You've only got three choices in life: Give up, give in, or give it all you've got.
author: Unknown Author 954

quote: .Ensuring that young people get the right information that will enable them make the right choices is a responsibility all citizens must take seriously
author: Oche Otorkpa, The Unseen Terrorist
category: choices, citizens, information, responsibilty, teenagers, teens, youth

quote: My greatest fear is having to face God and explain to Him why I wasn't able to fulfill my purpose.
author: Yvonne Pierre, The Day My Soul Cried:  A Memoir
category: choices, faith, fear, god, life, purpose

quote: ... I've run out of options. Stay with the lying psycho or work for the other lying psycho.
author: H.M. Ward, The Arrangement 14: The Ferro Family

quote: It is not our abilities that show who we truly are, it is our choices.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Be a good person, do good things, learn, and love other people, but do these things because you love yourself, God, life and people, not because you fear going to hell if you don’t. Keep the commandments (or whatever tenets you believe) because you want to be happy. Do it for you. God and the universe will unconditionally love you no matter which path you choose. You can learn whatever lessons you choose for yourself. If you want to learn things the hard way and experience fear, guilt and shame that is okay. But nothing you do (or don’t do) can separate you from love.
author: Kimberly Giles, Choosing Clarity: The Path to Fearlessness
category: choices, fear, learn, lessons, life, love

quote: The universe uses every experience you have to help you grow and learn. No experience is wasted. Every choice you make and everything that happens to you because of other people’s choices become your perfect lessons. As you learn to trust this truth, you will experience less fear and more peace.
author: Kimberly Giles, Choosing Clarity: The Path to Fearlessness

quote: I can't say for sure if I'm better off, since I have no way of knowing what would have been. I could have traveled to exotic places and kissed exotic men in the moonlight. Or I could have ended living alone in a dumpy apartment with the flesh eating virus I contracted from a public toilet. Could haves are always a great unknown.
author: Anna White, Mended: Thoughts on Life, Love, and Leaps of Faith
category: choices, humor, humorous-life, inspirational-quote, life, memoir, unknown, unknown-quote

quote: Say no to everything, so you can say yes to the one thing.
author: Richie Norton
category: choice, choices, decision-making, decisions, everything, no, one-thing, say-yes, saying-no

quote: Make a decision and then make it right. There just are no wrong decisions.
author: Abraham Hicks

quote: None of us gets to choose how we're born, it's what we make of ourselves afterwards.
author: Kenneth Oppel, Skybreaker

quote: God will help you make the choices that guide you into His path for each stage and age of your life.
author: Elizabeth George, A Woman After God's Own Heart
category: choices, christian, faith, god, guide, heart, life, love, path, stage, woman, women

quote: I guess that's the lesson in all of this-not to be eighty years old, looking back on your life, wondering if you made the right choice or how your life might have been different if you'd done one thing and not another.
author: Mary Simses, The Irresistible Blueberry Bakeshop & Cafe

quote: When you marry a woman out of pity, then its a pity that you'll send her away very soon.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: choice, choices, decision, driving-away, husband, making-choices, marriage, marry, michael-bassey-johnson, mistake, pity, wife, woman, women, wrong-choice

quote: The choices that women make sometimes seems provoking and at the same time amusing. I once met a lady who said she liked my amusing facial expression.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: ado, amazement, amazing, amuse, amusing, attraction, bait, behaviour, choices, every-woman, eyes, facial, facial-expression, feeling, frivolity, funny, girls, humour, intimacy, ladies, likes, liking, love, love-signal, lure, luring, michael-bassey-johnson, preference, woman, women

quote: For good-intentioned people making decisions, there's no such thing as a bad choice. So it doesn't matter what you choose. Choose something, then deliberately line up with the choice you make. This is the art of alignment and allowing. (paraphrased)
author: Abraham Hicks
category: choice, choices, decide, deciding, decisions, deliberate-creation, life

quote: The truth is there are always three choices: the right one, the wrong one and the one that is called "No Choice". As you may guessed, the "No Choice" one is a rule of a bad interpreter.
author: Galina Nelson
category: choices, education, inspiration, rules, spiritual, truth

quote: My dad told me that God allows people to make their own choices and doesn’t override their free will. That is why bad things happen. People don’t do the things they should.
author: J.W. Lord

quote: I say this because all religions, accurately understood, will take away your fear of not being enough. I believe there is a way to understand the tenets of your religion, right now, that will take away your fear and make you feel loved and safe. The problem is that no matter what you believe or to which religion you belong, there are two ways you can experience your beliefs. There is a fear way you can experience your religion, and a love way to experience it. All religions can be experienced both ways. All life philosophies can be experienced both ways too.If you search your personal books of scripture, you will find both ideas equally represented. There will be verses or sections that validate a fear-based view of God and there will be some that validate a love-based view of God. Don’t be confused by this. Both ideas had to be represented for you to have free agency. Anything less than equal representation of each idea would take away your freedom to choose.
author: Kimberly Giles, Choosing Clarity: The Path to Fearlessness

quote: It is impossible to erase my choices.
author: Veronica Roth, Allegiant

quote: Now the choices you make are not about finding your path. Rather, they are choices to open the path you have found.
author: Ilchi Lee, Human Technology: A Toolkit for Authentic Living

quote: Intelligence is not expecting people to understand what your intent is
author: it is anticipating how it will be perceived.

quote: Students will read if we give them the books, the time, and the enthusiastic encouragement to do so. If we make them wait for the one unit a year in which they are allowed to choose their own books and become readers, they may never read at all. To keep our students reading, we have to let them.
author: Donalyn Miller, The Book Whisperer: Awakening the Inner Reader in Every Child

quote: I am wearing a gray shirt, blue jeans, black shoes--new clothes, but beneath them, my Dauntless tattoos. It is impossible to erase my choices. Especially these.
author: Veronica Roth, Allegiant

quote: Sometimes love is not enough.
author: Sarah MacLean, No Good Duke Goes Unpunished

quote: She had all day every day to figure out some decent and satisfying way to live, and yet all she ever seemed to get for all her choices and all her freedom was more miserable. The autobiographer is almost forced to the conclusion that she pitied herself for being so free.
author: Jonathan Franzen, Freedom

quote: We all make choices, Cossack. Who we are in this world, what we do in it. Generous or selfish. Happy or sad. Good or evil. It's all down to choice.
author: Anthony Horowitz, Russian Roulette: The Story of an Assassin

quote: Aren't we all victims of fate?
author: Sarah MacLean, No Good Duke Goes Unpunished

quote: You talked to us about what kind of fifth-graders we wanted to be this year. How it was all in our choices, every minute of our days. How even grownups like you had to think about it sometimes, to be the person they wanted to be.
author: W.H. Beck, Malcolm at Midnight

quote: Better to choose a limit capriciously than to have none.
author: Thomas Hardy, A Pair of Blue Eyes

quote: Like the line of love, I thought. Once crossed you can't go back. Like the line between past and future. Or maybe really the line between past and now. The now my father spoke of. When I raced ... I would cross the line and there was no more thinking about what was going to be because it was. It happened that fast.
author: Adam Berlin Belmondo Style

quote: It was the human's fault that our worlds separated, and because they separated, I had to choose.  I hate choosing.  Why are humans always so insistent on picking one thing or the other?  If one must choose, why not pick the option that allows both?""Because our lives are short . . . so we have to make decisions . . . to move forward.  Because sometimes . . . you can't have everything.
author: Addison Lane, Drowning Fergus

quote: Some choices are harder than they appear. You can never say yes to one thing without saying no to another.
author: Chris Coppernoll, A Beautiful Fall

quote: Such a simple concept, yet so true. That which we manifest is before us, we are the creators of our own destiny.
author: Garth Stein, The Art of Racing in the Rain

quote: Life's too short to play it safe sometimes. (If he feels something special about Emma, he should go for it.)
author: Chris Coppernoll, A Beautiful Fall

quote: Dark times call for dark choices. Choose me.
author: Mark  Lawrence, Emperor of Thorns
category: choice, choices, choose, dark, jorg-ancrath, the-broken-empire

quote: Life is made of moments. and choices. Not all of them matter, or have any lasting impact. Skipping class in favor of a taste of freedom, picking a prom dress because of the way it transforms you into a princess in the mirror. Even the nights you steal away from an open window, tiptoe silent to the end of the driveway, where darkened headlights and the pull of something unknown beckon. These are all small choices, really. Insignificant as soon as they’re made. Innocent.But then.Then there’s a different kind of moment. One when things are irrevocably changed by a choice we make. A moment we will play endlessly in our minds on lonely nights and empty days. One we’ll search repeatedly for some indication that what we chose was right, some small sign that tells us the truth isn’t nearly as awful as it feels. Or as awful as anyone would think if they knew.So we explain it to ourselves, justify it enough to sleep. And then we bury it deep, so deep we can almost pretend it never happened. But as much as we wish it were different, the truth is, our worlds are sometimes balanced on choices we make and the secrets we keep.
author: Jessi Kirby, Golden
category: choices, freedom, innocence, justify, life, moments, secrets, truth

quote: In life we always have some measure of control whether it be over our emotions or choices, but when it comes to cancer? The only thing you can control is how you respond to it
author: Rachel Van Dyken, Ruin

quote: We reach for the same brand not because we trust its quality but because we want to reassure ourselves that we made a smart choice the last time we bought it.
author: David McRaney, You Are Not So Smart: Why You Have Too Many Friends on Facebook, Why Your Memory Is Mostly Fiction, and 46 Other Ways You're Deluding Yourself

quote: I love you enough to tell you the truth whether you want to hear it or not, but what you do afterward is your choice alone.
author: Ashley Ormon
category: choices, correction, decisions, honesty-love-honesty, life, love, truth

quote: If you have to choose between something that has form and something that doesn't, go for the one without form. That's my rule.
author: Haruki Murakami, Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman

quote: Commonsense will never come from following your heart
author: wisdom is only stored in the mind.

quote: You have two choices in life: you can dissolve into the mainstream or you can be distinct. To be distinct, you must be different. To be different, you must strive to be what no one else but you can be.
author: Alan Ashley-Pitt
category: choices, different, dissolve, distinct, life, mainstream, no-one, strive

quote: Life is, if anything, the art of combination. Of discrimination. Of freely picking one's own personal pattern out of a hundred choices. Not letting it be picked for you—either by the Establishment, or by the Rebels. Conformity of Hip is no better than Conformity of Square.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: I really wondered why people were always doing what they didn't like doing. It seemed like life was a sort of narrowing tunnel. Right when you were born, the tunnel was huge. You could be anything. Then, like, the absolute second you were born, the tunnel narrowed down to about half the size. . . . I figured that, on the day you died, the tunnel would be so narrow, you'd have squeezed yourself in with so many choices, that you just got squashed.
author: Carol Rifka Brunt, Tell the Wolves I'm Home

quote: When you’ve tired of me,” she said softly, precisely, “Apollo will still be my brother. Will still be there for me.”“I’ll never tire of you,” he said, knowing with every thread of his soul that he spoke the absolute truth.“Then prove it.”He knew what she asked with such an open and vulnerable face. Something within him shriveled and died... he’d been on the rack too long for a penance he wasn’t sure he could ever entirely pay. “You know…” His voice was hoarse, the croaking of a dying man. He licked his lips. “You know why I cannot.
author: Elizabeth Hoyt, Duke of Midnight

quote: To relate oneself expectantly to the possibility of the good is to hope. To relate oneself expectantly to the possibility of evil is to fear. By the decision to choose hope one decides infinitely more than it seems, because it is an eternal decision
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Our debts don't leave us much in terms of choices. We can choose to pay now or try to pay later. But the longer we wait the steeper the bill
author: Ziad K. Abdelnour, Economic Warfare: Secrets of Wealth Creation in the Age of Welfare Politics

quote: The only sane response to change is to find the opportunity in it.
author: Jeff Jarvis

quote: There is the right way and a million other ways. Eliminating the other options prevents limiting your results.
author: Kyle Barger
category: choices, decide, decisions, million, options, path, question, results

quote: We lust after the material things in life, then in a blink of an eye; the life which was once given is taken; is there a point in stressing over the small stuff.
author: Epiphana Lewis
category: choices, inspirational, living-life, motivational, outlook, positive

quote: Give us being and feeling over having any day.
author: Mireille Guiliano, French Women Don't Get Fat: The Secret of Eating for Pleasure

quote: Understanding what I give up and knowing that I choose freely makes my choice more precious to me.
author: Jennifer Beckstrand, Kate's Song

quote: Sometimes you have to make choices, and they're imperfect, but they're the only choices you can make and live with yourself.
author: Charles Sheehan-Miles, The Last Hour

quote: Sometimes you simply made the wrong choice and you had to live with it. You could only change the future.
author: Kristin Hannah, Fly Away

quote: You have to be happy with who you are and the choices you make. If you don't like yourself, you'll never be truly happy.
author: Taylor Swift

quote: She felt trapped, but she didn't have to. The world is wide open and ready, waiting for us to escape this bubble and join it.
author: C.M. Stunich, Losing Me, Finding You
category: choices, confinement, confusion, decisions, escape, fears, immobile, insecurities, inspirational, joyfulness, life, life-lessons, trapped

quote: It was one thing to stay in one place If you were happy and fulfilled- that was simply living the good life. But what if you weren't fulfilled?
author: Syrie James, The Missing Manuscript of Jane Austen

quote: You also have a part to play in this adventure, and that part was written for you before you long before you were born.''Are you saying I have no choice?''We all have choices. But our decisions are already known.
author: Anthony Horowitz, Evil Star

quote: What happened? How did I get here? How could I have known that my choices mattered?
author: Isaac Marion, The New Hunger

quote: We all are manufacturers in a way - making good, making trouble or making excuses.
author: H. V. Adolt

quote: I was asked a series of ques
author: Julio Alexi Genao, When You Were Pixels

quote: He believed in people. He believed that if people could only be shown the right way-the way to health and order, a way to be free of unhappiness-they would make the right choice. They would obey.
author: Lauren Oliver, Requiem

quote: I didn’t know what
author: Julio Alexi Genao, When You Were Pixels

quote: it turns out we were some peoplewhich has been chosen by God to be happy in a different way# beggars
author: ys sroyer

quote: We are made by the choices we make. We are defined, not by how or where we were born but what we make out of the "where" and "how"; not much of how we started but more of how we decide to end.
author: Olaotan Fawehinmi

quote: Do not be so attached to life otherwise you will end up struggling for life. Choice is yours.
author: Nadair Desmar

quote: The past hadn't been erased just because a new future had been handed it.
author: Susan Meissner, Lady in Waiting

quote: Consumers presented with six choices on an item were twice as likely to buy as consumers overwhelmed with 24 varieties of the same item.
author: Sheena Iyengar

quote: Our nature gives us purpose, to reflect and act upon, responsibly by choice.
author: Xavier Rosseel

quote: You will always be a monster - there is no turning back from it. But what kind of monster you become is entirely up to you.
author: Julie Kagawa, The Eternity Cure

quote: Where were we? I've forgotten. He was deciding whether to cut her throat or love her forever.Right. Yes. The usual choices.
author: Margaret Atwood, The Blind Assassin

quote: Have you ever been torn between two impossibilities and knew in your heart that no matter which way you went or which path you chose that you were doomed to unhappiness?
author: Maya Banks, Sweet Addiction

quote: The opposite of hope is despair, and when we despair, it is because we feel there are no choices.
author: Warren G. Bennis, On Becoming a Leader

quote: Choice, and all its attendant energy, is a characteristic of youth. It is before one chooses that one feels desire and longing without fulfillment, which gives an edge to any artistic endeavor. Galway Kinnell recently said in an interview that a young poet has so many choices but an old poet must simply endure his chosen life.
author: Mary Ruefle, Madness, Rack, and Honey: Collected Lectures

quote: Humans make their own history, but not under circumstances of their choosing.
author: John Lanchester, Capital

quote: No matter what your origin or beliefs, rather adolescent or full grown. Thoughts are scribed in pencil but actions are carved in stone
author: Carl Henegan, Darkness Left Undone
category: actions, adolescence, beliefs, choices, opinions, stone

quote: Remember it is your choice
author: you can either wait for someone or end someone’s waiting.

quote: If you want change and don’t make choices that reflect the change, you are making a choice to keep things the same.
author: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: His hands are behind his back.'Choose,' he says.'I've already made my choice,' I say, and I grab the sleeve of his leather jacket and pull him inside.
author: Jill Hathaway, Slide

quote: It may not make sense to you, now, but when you get older you'll understand that sometimes things have to be done. Hard things. But everyone will hate the person who finally does them. But if they do them anyway, that's the mark of true honor.
author: Rhiannon Held Silver

quote: The simple rule: some get saved, but most don't. The choices are important before the years begin to go so very fast.
author: Jill McCorkle, Life After Life

quote: I was not 15 anymore, and choices no longer had that same clear, bright edge to them.
author: Geraldine Brooks, Year of Wonders

quote: The way I see it people don't do what they want to do often enough. They just do some alternative which they'd kind of like to do, which isn't the same thing at all, and as a result that thing isn't enough and they end up depressed and annoyed with everyone else around them.
author: Will Davis, My Side Of The Story

quote: Life is a treasure-chest of opportunities, choices, and time. Unfortunately, the choice many people make is to argue about the details of the chest instead of seizing the treasure within it.
author: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
category: chest, choices, happiness, inspirational, life, opportunities, treasure

quote: If I ever have to cast an acting role, I want the wrong person for the part. I can never visualize the right person in a part. The right person for the right part would be too much. Besides, no person is every completely right for any part, because part in a role is never real, so if you can't get someone who's perfectly right, it's more satisfying to get someone who's perfectly wrong. Then you know you've really got something.
author: Andy Warhol, A Retrospective
category: art, choices, decisions, right, role, warhol, wrong

quote: My father warned me that you’re an interloper. He told me I should make you leave, since we’re no longer married and you’re not my concern,” he says. The thought gives me a chill. Yes, I’m sure Vaughn would love for his son to abandon me, so that Vaughn can swoop in and reclaim me the second I’m alone. But Linden adds, “I told him that wouldn’t be a good idea either.
author: Lauren DeStefano, Sever
category: bad, choices, destefano, good, lauren, lauren-destefano, love

quote: He shrugged, "...my conscience rests easiest if I do only what I see as best in the moment...
author: Anihyr Moonstar

quote: The ripple effect. You throw a pebble into the water and it creates ripples. Your action was to throw the pebble—the representation of your choice. That’s all that you can control. But not the ripples—those are the consequences of your choice. And that you cannot control.
author: Michele Bardsley

quote: But now, O Lord, you are our Father; we are the clay, and you are our potter; we are all the work of your hand.
author: Isaiah 64 8

quote: Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, but I chose neither one. Instead, I set sail in my little boat to watch a sunset from a different view that couldn't be seen from shore. Then I climbed the tallest mountain peak to watch the amber sun through the clouds. Finally, I traveled to the darkest part of the valley to see the last glimmering rays of light through the misty fog. It was every perspective I experienced on my journey that left the leaves trodden black, and that has made all the difference.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: being-different, change, changing, choices, inspirational, life, life-journeys, life-missions, life-purpose, perspective, robert-frost, the-road-less-taken

quote: The most important journey you will take in your life will usually be the one of self transformation. Often, this is the scariest because it requires the greatest changes, in your life.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: choices, journeys, life-mission, life-purpose, relationships, self-realization, self-transformation, spiritual-journeys

quote: He is worse than the others, I show. He is worst of all of them.Because–Because he knew he was doing wrong. He felt the pain of his actions–But he did not amend them, shows the Sky.The rest are worth as much as their pack animals, I show, but worst is the one who knows better and does nothing.
author: Patrick Ness, Monsters of Men

quote: Empowerment is being aware that there is no one to blame for my choices and actions
author: that I have a personal choice and responsibility for my life.
category: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Choose to do more than just exist
author: choose to live.
category: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Which do I care more about - demanding my rights or displaying right choices?
author: Lysa TerKeurst, Unglued Devotional: 60 Days of Imperfect Progress

quote: You are more than the choices that you make, You are more than the sum of your past mistakes, You are more than the problems you create.
author: Tenth Avenue North

quote: Good-bye,” I say to Grandfather, and to my father, and I hold the tube in the river and pause a moment. We hold the choices of our fathers and mothers in our hands and when we cling on or let them slip between our fingers, those choices become our own.
author: Ally Condie, Reached

quote: People always have choices. They might not always have options, but they do have choices.
author: Kasey Michaels, This Can't Be Love

quote: Our decisions define our lives. We are the people we choose to be in the ways that most matter. Choose wisely. You will live with the choices you make.The choices you make define your character. And your character defines how you feel about yourself. That image of you is projected in hundreds of ways to others.
author: Vicki Hinze

quote: I'm going out to find her, to make things right, or atleast properly wrong.
author: Neal Shusterman

quote: It is not by regretting what is irreparable that true work is to be done, but by making the best of what we are. It is not by complaining that we have not the right tools, but by using well the tools we have. What we are, and where we are is God's providential arrangement - God's doing, though it may be man's misdoing; and the manly and the wise way is to look your disadvantages in the face, and see what can be made our of them.
author: Will Schwalbe, The End of Your Life Book Club

quote: Did you know Grandfather would give the poems to me?” I ask.“We thought he might,” my mother says.“Why didn’t you stop him?”“We didn’t want to take away your choices,” my mother says.“But Grandfather never did tell me about the Rising,” I say.“I think he wanted you to find your own way,” my mother says. She smiles. “In that way, he was a true rebel. I think that’s why he chose that argument with your father as his favorite memory. Though he was upset when the fight happened, later he came to see that your father was strong in choosing his own path, and he admired him for it.
author: Ally Condie, Reached

quote: Thirteen years of friendship had bonded us together more thoroughly than if we had been born of the same mother. Even at this late stage, I was unwilling to let him go.
author: Melika Dannese Lux, Corcitura
category: betrayal, brotherhood, choices, corcitura, decisions, eric-bradburry, friendship, stefan-ratliff

quote: Well, I guess it’s all in God’s hands anyway. He has a way of making things turn out,” Mattie asserted.“Yes, He does. Doesn’t He? Thank you for reminding me of that, Mattie.” She gave her friend a hug. “Sometimes it’s hard not to second guess the choices I’ve made.”“I know what you mean. When life brings changes, I think we tend to do that more.” Mattie wiped away a tear. “I miss the old life sometimes, but I know this is God’s will for me. And God’s will is always best, whether we realize it at the time or not.
author: J.E.B. Spredemann, Amish by Accident

quote: Circumstances don't determine who you are, or what you will be. Only you do that. You either decide, or you don't. Even the decision not to decide was still yours.
author: Julie-Anne

quote: You are never wrong doing the right thing.
author: Wayde Goodall, Why Great Men Fall: 15 Winning Strategies to Rise Above It All

quote: Do what is right because it is right.
author: Nancy Slocumb

quote: And I envied her that she had chosen her work herself and was doing what she wanted to do. I don't suppose I had any idea what I 'wanted' and so I was chosen, not choosing. There's glory and honor in being chosen. But not much room for free will.
author: Elizabeth Wein, Code Name Verity

quote: There were always choices. I’d made a string of bad ones myself. At least I could admit that.
author: Jennifer L. Armentrout, Onyx

quote: The choice is not in what you do. The choice is in the why.
author: Emma Raveling, Billow

quote: The direction you choose to face determines whether you're standing at the end or the beginning of a road.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: attitude, beginning, choices, end, outlook, richelle, richelle-goodrich, road, start, start-over

quote: It's one of the things that makes us different than they are, Harry. The blood on their hands does not make it right to bloody my own. My choices are measured against my own soul. Not against the stains on theirs.
author: Jim Butcher, Death Masks

quote: The realization of what would happen next settled gradually over Harry in the long minutes, like softly falling snow."I've got to go back, haven't I?""That is up to you.""I've got a choice?""Oh yes." Dumbledore smiled at him. "We are in King's Cross, you say? I think that if you decided not to go back, you would be able to…let's say…board a train.""And where would it take me?""On," said Dumbledore simply.
author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quote: Mistakes wreck your life. But they make what you have. It's kind of all one. You know what Hester told me when we were working the sheep one time? She said it's no good to complain about your flock, because it's the put-together of all your past choices.
author: Barbara Kingsolver, Flight Behavior

quote: People make decisions, and maybe you don't always agree, but those choices are still their own.
author: Brenna Yovanoff, The Space Between

quote: We allow ourselves to be blown by the winds because we do know what we want: our hearts know it, even if our thoughts are sometimes slow to follow- but in the end they do catch up with our hearts and then we think we have made a decision
author: Muhammad Asad, The Road to Mecca

quote: Freedom is anxiety's petri dish. If routine blunts anxiety, freedom incubates it. Freedom says, "Even if you don't want to make choices, you have to, and you can never be sure you have chosen correctly." Freedom says, "Even not to choose is to choose." Freedom says, "So long as you are aware of your freedom, you are going to experience the discomfort that freedom brings." Freedom says, "You're on your own. Deal with it.
author: Daniel Smith, Monkey Mind: A Memoir of Anxiety

quote: Our lives are like these things I make. Turn 'em, build 'em, bake 'em in fire. That's what you've been, son. Baked and fired. But a pot don't have the right to choose whether he be for water, wine, or just left empty. You have, son. You have.
author: Joanne Harris, Runemarks

quote: Regrets are the last words you speak to your loved ones when you die and the one thing we all fear when we live. I'd rather regret the things I've done and said than regret the things I haven't done or said. It is all the experiences and people you missed out on in life that you will feel the most regretful for in the end. God will forgive you of your mistakes, but there is nothing to forgive if you have never even tried, done or said anything that made a difference in your life or others.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: choices, experiences, freedom-of-speech, life, openness, regret

quote: Some people make choices hoping for the best
author: Korsak had made a choice simply to avoid the worst.

quote: Life is made up of chances to make choices, decisions of what you wish to do; the accumulated result of those choices is what you call your life.
author: Steven Redhead, The Solution
category: accumulated, chances, choices, decisions, life, results, wish

quote: Today is the day to stop, look around, realize where you are in relation to where you want to be, change direction if needed and move forward with faith in God and in yourself.
author: Toni Sorenson
category: change, choices, faith, god, happiness, life

quote: A moment of choice is a moment of truth. It's the testing point of our character and competence.
author: Stephen R. Covey

quote: We try so hard because it is all we've ever known, I thought. We try to fit ourselves into this world so that we don't seem more different than different, an oddity in a sea of normality. We try because it is only instinct, but we obey because it is law.
author: Nadège Richards, Burning Bridges
category: choices, decisions, differences, inspirational, life, love, trying

quote: His ambition was not to become wealthy or to be well known, an image which society for some reason dictates each individual should prescribe to, instead his only ambition was to be at peace with himself, if he could achieve that than anything else he might need would follow. From now on he would question all things in life, but especially the rules and regulations of all authority institutions; he would take nothing on face value and only would accept what he personally knew to undeniably be true.
author: Andrew James Pritchard, Charnel House

quote: Life truly becomes exactly what you make it. All the choices lead to the reality you are experiencing.
author: Steven Redhead, Keys to The Laws of Creation

quote: ThinkWhen did it go wrong?The break-in?No, before that.The party?That was part of it, but that wasn't when it started.Zack?Of course, yeah, it would be easy to say it was Zack. But that's not it, is it?Before Zack.Before Ryan. Before Max and Derrick or that whole thing with the wallet.Before Ashley.Before tenth grade even began.And you're thinking, this can't be it.
author: Charles Benoit, You

quote: We are faced with choices every moment of our lives. Whatever choice we exercise must make us comfortable and at peace. Choices that are made out of fear and anxiety often do not lead to right action---Sasha Samy, Transcending Abuse & Betrayal.
